byline.original: By NIKITA STEWART and BENJAMIN MUELLER

abstract: Hundreds of protesters gather at Brooklyn federal courthouse to demand that federal civil rights charges be filed in death of Eric Garner in Staten Island; event marks new chapter in push by Garner's family for justice and police accountability in connection with spate of police killings of unarmed black men across nation.
lead_paragraph: Hundreds of people converged in front of the federal courthouse in Brooklyn to demand that federal civil rights charges be filed in the death of Eric Garner.

headline.main: Family Renews Calls for Civil Rights Charges a Year After Garner’s Death
headline.print_headline: Family Renews Calls for Civil Rights Charges a Year After Garner’s Death

snippet: Hundreds of people converged in front of the federal courthouse in Brooklyn to demand that federal civil rights charges be filed in the death of Eric Garner.
